title: Emmerdale spoilers: Victoria in danger as newcomer Luke linked to rapist Lee?
text:
Victoria Barton (Isabel Hodgins) has had an incredibly difficult year in Emmerdale after she was raped by Lee Posner during a night out. The young woman is seemingly set to find a little bit of happiness with newcomer Luke (Max Parker) — that is, unless Luke turns out to be dangerous, which a lot of viewers believe him to be.

Victoria’s world came crashing down earlier this year when, after a night out with her pals, she was raped by Lee. After the police were unable to bring a case against the rapist, Robert (Ryan Hawley) set about seeking revenge on her behalf, and ended up getting himself arrested and charged with GBH with intent.

Matters were made worse earlier this week when Lee died from his injuries, which led to Robert having to go on the run with husband Aaron (Danny Miller). As a result, Victoria has lost her brother too, and — with a baby on the way — she’s got a lot on her plate.

Despite her stresses, she could be set to find happiness, as it recently became apparent that there was chemistry between her and Luke — a man whom she met at the hospital last month.

During last night’s episode, the pair went for lunch — and they got along incredibly well. Yes, Luke certainly seems like a nice lad on the surface — and it’s nice to see Victoria getting on with her life after all that’s been through.

The question is: could there perhaps be more to Luke than meets the eye?

When the pair first met, Victoria was convinced that Luke was up to no good, which — considering everything that she’s been through, was more than justified — but, upon dicussing the matter further with Diane (Elizabeth Estensen), she came to the realisation that there was nothing to fear from this young man.

However, what if Luke is, in fact, dangerous? The character has accidentally bumped into Victoria on several occasions — something which he acknowledged during their second meeting — so could her perhaps be stalking her?

Since his first appearance at the hospital, some viewers have made clear on social media that they believe Luke’s linked to Lee, which — considering Victoria has only encountered Luke on hospital grounds when she’s been checking up on how Lee’s doing — is rather plausible.

Let’s not forget that it was a trip to the hospital which led to Victoria encountering Lee’s mum Wendy, so it’s entirely possible that history would repeat itself where Luke is concerned. If Luke is mates with Lee, then it would explain these ‘chance’ encounters, for sure.

What’s more, before Robert hit him with the shovel, Lee relayed how the rape trial had negatively impacted his reputation, so perhaps — in an attempt to seek revenge — he roped his mate into a plan to target Victoria? It’s certainly something he’d be capable of, given everything he’s already put Vic through.

If so, then the aim could be to get close to Victoria. However, the question is: is he simply be looking revenge, or is it the baby he’s after?

Luke demonstrated a certain degree of shock when he realised that Vic was pregnant during last night’s episode, but could he perhaps have been feigning such a reaction in order to give a more convincing performance?

Regardless of what his motivations might be, If Luke is operating on behalf of Lee, then he’ll no doubt up his game now that Lee has died.

Or maybe we’re jumping the gun and Luke’s just a nice guy?

Let’s hope it’s the latter, as if anyone deserves to be happy, it’s Victoria. Mind you, few people find happiness in the Dales, so whatever happens with Luke, there’ll no doubt be plenty more conflict to come.

Emmerdale continues on Wednesday 16th October at 7pm on ITV.
